result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive credit for 54 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to pay MONTHLY child support obligation.
2.  Defendant is to pay off arrearage.
3.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
4.  Court waives court costs.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
2:16 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to counts 1, 2 & 3 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1,2 & 3.  Court orders counts 4,5 & 6 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 - 18 months of Initial Confinement and 24 months of Extended Supervision stayed and places the defendant on probation for a period of 5 years.

COUNT 2 & 3 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 5 years.

CONDITIONS PROBATION & EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Defendant is to pay MONTHLY child support obligation.
Defendant is to pay off arrearage.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Court waives court costs.

Court grants the defendant 54 days of sentence credit.

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the CIP and for the SAP programs if defendant becomes revoked.

Court adjourned at 2:26 p.m.

11:37 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  State has received a copy of the motion.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Court notes an arrest warrant was filed last September.  Argument by ADA - opposes the request and states reasons.  Further statement by Atty Privat.  Court questions ADA regarding Iowa warrant.  Statement by ADA was a fugitive warrant.  Statement by Atty Privat.  

Statement by the Court - denies the request for bond modification.

Court adjourned at 11:43 a.m.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - will be representing the defendant.  Statement by the Court - has received a letter and has made a copy for counsel.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Atty Privat requests to be heard on bond, and states reasons for the request.  Argument by DA.  Court denies the defendant's request for bond modification.  Court will set for status hearing on June 2, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:08 p.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Warrant has been canceled - talked with Rhonda at GLSO.
43
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $10,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for April 27, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.
Jefferson County Jail - April 16, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  (Return on Warrant/Initial Appearance)
